sentences.text: March 16, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Annual Meeting of Stockholders of PACCAR Inc, which will be held at the PACCAR Parts Distribution Center, located at 405 Houser Way North, Renton, Washington, at 10:30 a.m. on Tuesday, April 25, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal business of the Annual Meeting is stated on the attached Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also provide an update on the Companys activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR Items 1 and 2; a vote of THREE YEARS on Item 3; and a vote AGAINST Items 4 and 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your VOTE is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, please vote your proxy either by mail, telephone or the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark C. Pigott Executive Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Stockholders of PACCAR Inc will be held at 10:30 a.m. on Tuesday, April 25, 2017, at the PACCAR arts Distribution Center, located at 405 Houser Way North, Renton, Washington, for these purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect as directors the four Class I nominees named in the attached proxy statement to serve one-year terms ending in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To vote on an advisory resolution to approve executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To vote on an advisory basis on the frequency (every one, two or three years) of the stockholder advisory vote on executiv compensation (Item 2).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To vote on a stockholder proposal regarding supermajority vote provisions if properly presented at the meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To vote on a stockholder proposal regarding proxy access if properly presented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. To transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders entitled to vote at this meeting are those of record as of the close of business on February 28, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANT: The vote of each stockholder is important regardless of the number of shares held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, please complete and return your proxy form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directions to the PACCAR Parts Distribution Center in Renton, Washington can be found on the back cover of the attached proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: J. D. Clack Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bellevue, Washington March 16, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of PACCAR Inc issues this proxy statement to solicit proxies for use at the Annual Meeting of Stockholders at 10:30 a.m., local time, on Tuesday, April 25, 2017, at the PACCAR Parts Distribution Center in Renton, Washington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement includes information about the business matters that will be voted upon at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive offices of the Company are located at 777 106  Avenue N.E., Bellevue, Washington 98004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement and proxy form were first sent to stockholders on or about March 16, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders eligible to vote at the meeting are those identified as owners at the close of business on the record date, February 28, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each outstanding share of common stock is entitled to one vote on each of the items presented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the close of business on February 28, 2017, the Company had 351,254,900 shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may vote in person at the meeting or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Execution of a proxy does not affect the right of a stockholder to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that stockholders exercise their right to vote by promptly completing and returning the proxy form either by mail, telephone or the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting by Proxy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark C. Pigott and Charles R. Williamson are designated proxy holders to vote shares on behalf of stockholders at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy holders are authorized to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vote shares as instructed by the stockholders who have properly completed and returned the proxy form;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vote shares as recommended by the Board when stockholders have executed and returned the proxy form, but have given no instructions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vote shares at their discretion on any matter not identified in the proxy form that is properly brought before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Trustee for the PACCAR Inc Savings Investment Plan (the SIP) votes shares held in the SIP according to each members instructions on the proxy form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no voting instructions are received, the Trustee will vote the shares in direct proportion to the shares for which it has received timely voting instructions, as provided in the SIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Voting Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy form allows registered stockholders to vote in one of three ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may complete, sign, date and return the proxy form in the pre-addressed, postage-paid envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may call the toll-free number listed on the proxy form and follow the voting instructions given.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may access the internet address listed on the proxy form and follow the voting instructions given.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Telephone and internet voting procedures authenticate each stockholder by using a control number.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The voting procedures will confirm that your instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who vote by telephone or internet should not return the proxy form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who hold shares through a broker or agent should follow the voting instructions received from that broker or agent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revoking Proxy Voting Instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy may be revoked by a later-dated proxy or by written notice to the Secretary of the Company at any time before it is voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who hold shares through a broker should contact the broker or other agent if they wish to change their vote after executing the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Online Availability of Annual Meeting Materials
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the Annual Stockholder Meeting to be held at 10:30 a.m. on April 25, 2017, at the PACCAR Parts Distribution Center in Renton, Washington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 proxy statement and the 2016 Annual Report to stockholders are available on the Companys website at www.paccar.com/2017annualmeeting/.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who hold shares in a bank or brokerage account who previously elected to receive the annual meeting materials electronically and now wish to change their election and receive paper copies may contact their bank or broker to change their election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who receive annual meeting materials electronically will receive a notice when the proxy materials become available with instructions on how to access them over the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple Stockholders Sharing the Same Address
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registered stockholders at a shared address who would like to discontinue receipt of multiple copies of the annual report and proxy statement in the future should write to Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, Attn: Householding, P.O. Box 64854, St. Paul, Minnesota 55164-0854.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Street name stockholders at a shared address who would like to discontinue receipt of multiple copies of the annual report and proxy statement in the future should contact their bank or broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some street name stockholders elected to receive one copy of the 2016 Annual Report and 2017 Proxy Statement at a shared address prior to the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If those stockholders now wish to change that election, they may do so by contacting their bank, broker or PACCAR at 425.468.7495 or P.O. Box 1518, Bellevue, Washington 98009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required and Method of Counting Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence at the Annual Meeting, in person or by duly authorized proxy, of a majority of all the stock issued and outstanding and having voting power shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions are counted as shares present at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In an uncontested director election, each director nominee shall be elected by the affirmative vote of the majority of the votes cast with respect to that directors election at any meeting for the election of directors at which a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of votes cast means that the number of shares voted for a directors election exceeds 50 percent of the number of votes cast with respect to that directors election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes cast include votes against but exclude abstentions and broker nonvotes with respect to that directors election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Company Bylaws, an incumbent director that is not elected by a majority vote will tender his or her
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: resignation subject to acceptance by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Certificate of Incorporation does not provide for cumulative voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies signed, dated and returned unmarked will be voted FOR all of the nominees for Class I Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that brokers and custodians may not vote on the election of directors in the absence of specific client instruction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those who hold shares in such accounts are encouraged to provide voting instructions to the broker or custodian.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee is unable to act as director because of an unexpected occurrence, the proxy holders may vote the proxies for another person or the Board of Directors may reduce the number of directors to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies signed, dated and returned unmarked will be voted FOR Item 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be approved, Item 2 must receive the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the effect of a vote against the item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies signed, dated and returned unmarked will be voted for holding a non-binding, advisory vote on executive compensation every THREE YEARS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may cast an advisory vote on how frequently stockholders will be asked to vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may select every one, two or three years or may abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a plurality of the shares present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting will constitute the stockholder preference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will not affect the outcome of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Items 4 and 5:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies signed, dated and returned unmarked will be voted AGAINST Items 4 and 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be approved, Items 4 and 5 must receive the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the effect of a vote against each item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Four Class I directors are to be elected at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The persons named below have been designated by the Board as nominees for election as Class I directors for a term expiring at the Annual Meeting of Stockholders in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the nominees are currently serving as directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD NOMINEES FOR CLASS I DIRECTORS (TERMS EXPIRE AT THE 2018 ANNUAL MEETING)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BETH E. FORD, age 53, is group executive vice president and chief operating officer at Land OLakes, a member-owned agricultural production and dairy cooperative and has held that position since November 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She previously served as executive vice president and chief supply chain and operations officer at Land OLakes since 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Ford served as executive vice president and head of supply chain at International Flavor and Fragrances (2008-2011).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Ford has served as a director of Clearwater Paper Corporation since 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She is on the Deans Advisory Committee for the College of Business at Iowa State University and the Board of Advisors at the Columbia University Business School  Deming Center.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She has served as a director of the Company since April 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Ford has the attributes and qualifications listed in the Company guidelines for board membership including an MBA from Columbia University Business School and a BBA from Iowa State University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Ford has a background in agribusiness, chemicals, consumer package goods, publishing and oil and gas gained through 30 years in operating and senior leadership positions with global companies including International Flavor and Fragrances, PepsiCo, Hachette Book Group, Scholastic Corporation and Mobil Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KIRK S. HACHIGIAN, age 57, is executive chairman of JELD-WEN, inc., a global manufacturer of windows and doors and has held that position since December 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He previously served as chairman, president and chief executive officer of JELD-WEN, inc. from April 2014 through December 2015, as a principal of SkyKarr Capital LLC, a private investment firm, from 2013 to March 2014 and as chairman, president and chief executive officer of Cooper Industries plc, a global manufacturer of electrical products, from 2006 until it was acquired by Eaton Corporation in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as lead director for Allegion plc and as a director of NextEra Energy Inc. since 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as a director of the Company since 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hachigian has the attributes and qualifications listed in the Company guidelines for board membership including a degree in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: engineering from UC Berkeley and an MBA from the University of Pennsylvanias Wharton School.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to his 11 years of service with Cooper, he served eight years as an executive with General Electric Corporation including two years in Mexico and three years in Asia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RODERICK C. MCGEARY, age 66, served in consulting and audit roles with KPMG LLP from 1972 to 2000 culminating in the position as co-vice chairman of consulting (1997-1999).

sentences.text: BOARD GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that the following persons served as independent directors in 2016 as defined by NASDAQ Rule 5605(a)(2): Dame Alison J. Carnwath, Beth E. Ford, Kirk S. Hachigian, Luiz Kaufmann, Roderick C. McGeary, Mark A. Schulz, Gregory M. E. Spierkel and Charles R. Williamson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors maintains a corporate governance section on the Companys website, which includes key information about its governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines, its Board committee charters and its Code of Business Conduct and Code of Ethics for Senior Financial Officers are located at www.paccar.com/company/corporateresponsibility/boardofdirectors.asp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys leadership structure includes an Executive Chairman, a Chief Executive Officer and an independent lead director who serves for a three-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C. R. Williamson currently serves as lead director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This leadership structure, in which the roles of the Executive Chairman and Chief Executive Officer are separate, together with an experienced and engaged lead director and independent key committees, is appropriate for the Company at this time because it effectively allocates authority, responsibility and oversight between management, the Executive Chairman and the independent members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has policies to ensure a strong and independent board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly meets in executive session without management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director presides over the executive sessions of the Boards independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Seventy-three percent of the Companys eleven current directors are independent as defined under NASDAQ rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board oversees risk through management presentations at Board meetings and through its Audit, Compensation and Nominating and Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee charter provides that the Committee shall discuss with management the Companys risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control such exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process, the Committee receives periodic reports from the Companys internal auditor and from its general counsel and the Committee reports to the full Board at least four times a year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees risk arising from the Companys compensation programs and annually reviews how those programs manage and mitigate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee oversees potential risks regarding governance by monitoring legal developments and trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary will receive, process and acknowledge receipt of all written stockholder communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Suggestions or concerns involving accounting, internal controls or auditing matters will be directed to the Audit Committee chairman.

sentences.text: Concerns regarding other matters will be directed to the individual director or committee named in the correspondence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no identification is made, the matter will be directed to the Executive Committee of the Board.

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has responsibility for the selection, evaluation and compensation of the independent auditors and approval of all services they provide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually assesses the independent public accounting firms qualifications, independence, performance and whether there should be a rotation of the Companys independent accounting firm.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews the Companys annual and quarterly financial statements, monitors the integrity and effectiveness of the audit process and reviews the corporate compliance programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It monitors the Companys system of internal controls over financial reporting and oversees the internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee charter describes the Committees responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee met six times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has responsibility for reviewing and approving salaries and other compensation matters for executive officers.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also evaluates the CEOs performance annually in executive session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It approves the attainment of annual and long-term goals by the executive officers.

sentences.text: Nominating and Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee is responsible for evaluating director candidates and selecting nominees for approval by the independent members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also makes recommendations to the Board on corporate governance matters including director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has established written criteria for the selection of new directors, which are available at www.paccar.com/company/corporateresponsibility/boardguidelines.asp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The criteria state that a diversity of perspectives, skills and business experience relevant to the Companys global operations should be represented on the Board including international business, manufacturing, financial services and aftermarket customer programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be a qualified director candidate, a person must have achieved significant success in business, education or public service, must not have a conflict of interest and must be committed to representing the long-term interests of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the candidate must have the following attributes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the highest ethical and moral standards and integrity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the intelligence, education and experience to make a meaningful contribution to board deliberations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the commitment, time and diligence to effectively discharge board responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: mature judgment, objectivity, practicality and a willingness to ask difficult questions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the commitment to work together as an effective group member to deliberate and reach consensus for the betterment of the stockholders and the long-term viability of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the names of director candidates submitted by management and members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also considers recommendations by stockholders submitted in writing to: Chairman, Nominating and Governance Committee, PACCAR Inc, 11  Floor, P.O. Box 1518, Bellevue, WA 98009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations by stockholders must include information set forth in the Company Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee engages the services of a private search firm from time to time to assist in identifying and screening director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluates qualified director candidates and selects nominees for approval by the members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Director Compensation Program

sentences.text: In addition to the cash compensation described in footnote (a) above, on the first business day of the year, each non-employee director received $130,020 in restricted stock or restricted stock units under the stockholder
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approved Restricted Stock and Deferred Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors (RSDC Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares received is determined by dividing $130,000 by the closing price of a share of Company stock on the first business day of the year and rounding up to the nearest whole share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors newly elected during the calendar year receive a prorated award to reflect the number of calendar quarters the director will serve in the year of election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted shares vest three years after the date of grant or upon retirement, death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors receive dividends and voting rights on all shares during the vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If non-employee directors elect to receive a credit to the stock unit account in lieu of a grant of restricted stock, the account is credited with the number of shares otherwise applicable to the grant of restricted stock and subject to the same vesting conditions as discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors may elect to defer all or a part of their cash retainer and fees to an income account or to a stock unit account under the RSDC Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The income account accrues interest at a rate equal to the simple combined average of the monthly Aa Industrial Bond yield averages for the immediately preceding quarter and is compounded quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock unit accounts are credited with the number of shares of Company common stock that could have been purchased at the closing price on the date the cash compensation is payable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thereafter, dividends earned are treated as if they were reinvested at the closing price of Company stock on the date the dividend is payable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Compensation and Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company emphasizes pay for performance and equity-based incentive programs designed to compensate executives for generating outstanding performance for stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive-based pay (Pay for Performance) represents approximately 69 percent of the Named Executive Officers targe total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net income is the key metric in the annual incentive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key metrics for long-term incentive cash awards are three-year change in net income, return on sales and return on capital compared with Peer Companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officer stock ownership guidelines and holding requirements align executives long-term goals with that of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no employment contracts, excise tax gross ups or significant perquisites for executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee updated the LTIP and restricted stock programs to clarify the timing of vesting for each type of award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also updated the Senior Executive Yearly Incentive Compensation Plan and the LTIP to conform the language between plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not discount, backdate, reprice or grant equity awards retroactively and prohibits the buy-out of underwater options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company prohibits the hedging or pledging of Company stock or purchasing stock on margin for directors and executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company may claw back executive officer incentive compensation where a financial restatement is caused by fraud and the incentive compensation was based on financial results impacted by the restatement.

sentences.text: Compensation Program Objectives and Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCARs compensation programs are directed by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors (the Committee), composed exclusively of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The programs are designed to attract and retain high-quality executives, link incentives o the Companys performance and align the interests of management with those of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs offer compensation hat is competitive with companies that operate in the same industries globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCARs goal is to achieve superior performance measured against its industry peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has delivered 78 consecutive years of net income, paid annual dividends every year since 1941 and delivered excellent stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has outperformed the S&P 500 index for the 1-, 5-, 15-, and 20-year periods ending December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average annual total return to stockholders for 2016 was 38.3 percent versus 11.9 percent for the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation framework has these components:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-term performance compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fixed amount of compensation for performing day-to-day responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentive cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash awards that focus on the attainment of Company profit targets and individual business unit goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term performance compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An equity- and cash-based Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP) that focuses on long-term growth in stockholder value, including three-year performance versus industry peers as measured by net income change, return on sales and return on capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity-based compensation consists of stock options and restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that this combination of salary, cash incentives and equity-based compensation provides appropriate incentives for executives to deliver superior short- and long-term business performance and stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executive Officers and all U.S. salaried employees participate in the Companys retirement programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executive Officers also participate in the Companys unfunded Supplemental Retirement Plan described on page 28, which provides a retirement benefit to those employees affected by the maximum benefit limitations permitted for qualified plans by the Internal Revenue Code and other qualified plan benefit limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not provide any other significant perquisites or executive benefits to its Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Approval for the Companys Executive Compensation Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, stockholders voted on an advisory basis to approve the compensation of the Named Executive Officers (known as a say on pay vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over 98 percent of the shares voted approved the Companys compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes the stockholder vote affirms the Companys conservative approach to executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, an advisory vote was taken on the frequency with which we ask our stockholders to provide an advisory vote on our executive compensation program in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We proposed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that the vote would be held every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the shares that voted on this proposal approved a three year period for say-on-pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A say on pay vote will be held this year and is described on page 32.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Criteria
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers a number of important factors when reviewing and determining executive compensation, including job responsibilities, Company performance, business unit performance, individual performance and compensation for executives among peer organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers the opinion of the Chief Executive Officer when determining compensation for the executives that report to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Industry Compensation Comparison Groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee periodically utilizes information from published compensation surveys as well as compensation data from Peer Companies to determine if compensation for the Chief Executive Officer and other executive officers is competitive with the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that comparative compensation information should be used in its deliberations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It does not specify a target compensation level for any given executive but rather a range of target compensation The Committee has discretion to determine the nature and extent to which it will use comparative compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee periodically retains a compensation consultant to assess the competitiveness of the Companys compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee retained Mercer, a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh and McLennan Companies, to evaluate the executive base salaries and total compensation structure, which were previously reviewed in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer compiled compensation data from the Companys Peer Companies, as well as from a Mercer study concerning executive compensation in the United States and a Willis Towers Watson survey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer provided the Committee with aggregated data obtained from the surveyed companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The review found that the Companys salary structure midpoints were on average six percent below the market median and the base salaries for the executive officers were on average 10 percent below the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer reported its findings to the Committee and proposed a revised salary structure with midpoints increased six percent to approximately the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee adopted the proposed executive salary structure effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its analysis of comparative data, the Committee includes compensation data from Peer Companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Company measures its financial performance against Peer Companies when evaluating achievement of the cash portion of the LTIP Company performance goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews the composition of the Peer Companies annually to ensure the companies are appropriate for comparative purposes.

sentences.text: Base salary provides a level of compensation that is competitive with industry Peer Companies to attract and retain high-caliber executives.

sentences.text: The midpoints of the base salary ranges are set at approximately the market median of the 2016 Mercer report with the minimum salary at 70 percent of the midpoint and the maximum salary at 130 percent of the midpoint.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program provides yearly cash incentives for the Named Executive Officers to achieve annual Company profit and business unit goals.

sentences.text: 2016 awards are measured on a sliding scale as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A hallmark of the annual cash incentive program has been a consistent and rigorous focus on achieving the Companys annual ne income goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has chosen net income, not EBITDA or operating profit, as the chief financial metric for this program because it is the primary indicator of corporate performance to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When setting incentive compensation goals for the Named Executive Officers, the Committee believes that corporate performance is an appropriate measure of individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, all of the 2016 annual incentive compensation for the Chief Executive Officer and a substantial portion of the annual incentive compensation for each of the Named Executive Officers is based upon Company net income performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The net income goal is proposed by Company management and approved by the Board and the Committee before or within the first 90 days of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target level represents an amount of net income that the Committee determines is attainable with excellent performance under expected economic conditions.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee exercised discretion to reduce each Named Executive Officers maximum funding amount described below under the heading Tax Treatment in determining payout as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long- term cash awards for the 2014-2016 LTIP cycle have not been determined as of the date of this proxy statement because Peer Group comparison data was not available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum amount that may be paid to any eligible participant in any year under this program is $7,000,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The award is also subject to the conditions of payment set forth in the Long-Term Incentive Plan, as required by Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, in its sole discretion, may reduce or eliminate (but not increase) any award otherwise payable to the Named Executive Officers under each officers funding maximum based on the achievement of the LTIP goals, an assessment of individual performance and other factors within the discretion of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee includes stock options in its compensation program because stock options link the interests of executives directly with stockholders interests through increased individual stock ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are granted by the Committee once each year on a predetermined date after the fourth-quarter earnings release and are not repriced, backdated or purchased by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of options is determined by multiplying the executives base salary on the grant date by a target award percentage and dividing by the average closing price of the Companys stock on the first five trading days of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of stock options is the closing price of the Companys stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options become exercisable at the end of a three-year vesting period and expire ten years after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to January 1, 2014, a participant who elects early retirement at or after age 55 under a Company retirement plan, but before age 62, has 12 months from retirement to exercise vested options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested options are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For stock options granted after January 1, 2014, a participant who retires at age 62 with 15 years of service, but before age 65, has ten years from date of grant to exercise vested options and a prorated number of stock options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: which are not otherwise exercisable at the time of retirement will become immediately exercisable, and may thereafter be exercised by the participant at any time within ten years after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who retires at or after age 65 has the full term to exercise options and unvested options will continue to vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting may be accelerated in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee granted stock options on February 4, 2016 in accordance with the target award percentages listed on page 19.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stock options granted in 2016 vest and become exercisable on January 1, 2019, and remain exercisable until February 4, 2026 unless the participants employment terminates earlier for reasons other than retirement, or the participant is demoted to an ineligible position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual restricted stock program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based restricted stock is included in the program because it links the interests of executives directly with stockholders interests through increased individual stock ownership and adds a performance goal that is tied to the success of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee sets a Company performance goal on or before the first 90 days of the year, and restricted stock grants are made in the following year if the Committee determines that the performance goal is achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of restricted shares is determined by multiplying the executives base salary by the target award percentage and dividing by the average closing price of the Companys stock on the first five trading days of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted shares are valued at the closing price of the Companys stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock vests 25 percent on the first day of the month following the grant and an additional 25 percent on each succeeding first of January.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested shares are forfeited upon termination unless termination is by reason of death, disability or retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares vest immediately upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Named Executive Officer has the same rights as all other stockholders to vote the shares and receive cash dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance goal for 2016 was four percent after-tax return on revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goal was determined based on the return on revenues of heavy- and medium-duty truck manufacturers in Europe and North America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on revenue is defined as net income divided by total revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons described in the discussion of the IC in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Committee determined that return on revenue in 2016 would be determined excluding the non-recurring charge for the European Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 7, 2017, the Committee determined that the 2016 performance goal was achieved and approved restricted stock consistent with the target award percentages listed on page 19.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock granted on February 4, 2016 for 2015 performance is included on page 24.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation of the Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee applies the same compensation philosophy, policies and comparative data analysis to the Chief Executive Officer as it applies to the other Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer is the only officer with overall responsibility for all corporate functions and, as a result, has a greater percentage of his total compensation based on the overall financial performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under R. E. Armstrongs leadership in 2016, the Company achieved very good revenue and net income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed the Chief Executive Officers salary in 2016 versus the market data and approved a 12 percent salary increase, effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferral of Annual and Long-Term Performance Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee administers a Deferred Compensation Plan described on page 29 which allows eligible employees to defer cash incentive awards into an income account or a stock unit account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both accounts are unfunded and unsecured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program provides tax and retirement planning benefits to participants and market-based returns on amounts deferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain deferrals are subject to Internal Revenue Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts from the income account are made in cash either in a lump sum or in a maximum of 15 annual installments in accordance with the executives payment election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock unit accounts are paid out in Company stock either in a one-time distribution or in a maximum of 15 annual installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation in the Deferred Compensation Plan is voluntary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive officers are required to meet stock ownership guidelines that reflect alignment of senior executives long-term goals with that of the Company stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The minimum number of shares of company stock and deferred stock units expected to be held by each category of executive officer is as follows: the Chief Executive Officer  five times base salary; other Named Executive Officers  three times base salary; and other executive officers  one times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company executive officers have three years from the January first after the executive first holds the qualifying position to attain the stock ownership target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews compliance with the guidelines each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives who are not in compliance with the ownership threshold must retain all vested restricted stock and at least 50% of after-tax shares acquired through the exercise of stock options until the applicable stock ownership threshold is met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of January 1, 2017, all executive officers either had achieved the stock ownership threshold or were within the time allowed to meet it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Post-Termination Events
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has no written employment agreement with its Chief Executive Officer or with any Named Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive compensation programs provide full benefits only if a Named Executive Officer remains with the Company until normal retirement at age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, upon a termination without cause a Named Executive Officer retains vested benefits but receives no enhancements or severance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a termination for cause, the executive forfeits all benefits except those provided under a qualified pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term cash incentives are prorated upon retirement at age 62, with 15 years of service, or death and are awarded at the maximum level upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual restricted stock grants become fully vested at retirement, death or a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the benefits described in this section help it attract and retain its executive officers by providing financial security in the event of certain qualifying terminations of employment or a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fact that the Company provides these benefits does not materially affect other decisions that the Company makes regarding compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains a separation pay plan for all U.S. salaried employees that provides a single payment of up to six months of base salary in the event of job elimination in a business restructuring or reduction in the workforce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executive Officers are eligible for the benefit on the same terms as any other eligible U.S. salaried employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Accounting or Tax Treatment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company policy is to structure certain compensation arrangements in a manner intended to preserve tax deductions for executive compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash awards paid under either the IC Plan or the LTIP, stock options and performance-based restricted stock awards granted to Named Executive Officers who are subject to the $1 million dollar annual deduction limitation under Section 162(m) (each, a Covered Employee) are subject to certain conditions of payment intended to preserve deductibility imposed under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee establishes a yearly funding plan limit equal to a percentage of the Companys net income (the Annual Pool) and assigns a percentage of the Annual Pool to each Covered Employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the funding limit under the IC Plan equaled three percent of the Companys net income and the corresponding maximum share of such pool for the Chief Executive Officer and the next four most highly compensated Covered Employees was 43%, 21.7%, 18%, 8.8% and 8.5%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The funding limit for the LTIP equaled one percent of the Companys cumulative net income for the 2016-2018 performance cycle and the corresponding maximum share of such pool for the Chief Executive Officer and the next four most highly compensated Covered Employees was 50.2%, 19.9%, 15.5%, 7.3% and 7.1%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee can exercise discretion to reduce or eliminate any award otherwise payable to the Covered Employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee retains the flexibility to pay compensation that is not fully deductible within the limitations of Section 162(m) if it determines that such action is in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders in order to attract, retain and reward outstanding executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company offers compensation programs that are intended to be tax efficient for the Company and for the executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not provide any Executive Officer with a gross-up for taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Forfeiture
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the Board determines that an executive officer has engaged in misconduct detrimental to the Company, including fraudulent conduct which results in a material inaccuracy in the Companys financial statements, the officer may be terminated for cause and all unpaid compensation forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cause is defined to include: an act of embezzlement, fraud or theft; the deliberate disregard of the rules of the Company or a subsidiary; any unauthorized disclosure of any of the secrets or confidential information of the Company or a subsidiary; any conduct which constitutes unfair competition with the Company or a subsidiary; or inducing any customer of the Company or a subsidiary to breach any contracts with the Company or a subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The provisions do not allow for recoupment of base salary which has been previously paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the Board determines that an executive officer has engaged in fraud that has caused or substantially contributed to material restatement of the Companys financial statements, the Board in its discretion may recover from the officer or former officer any incentive compensation award which was based in whole or in part on financial results that were subject to a material restatement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee updated the LTIP and restricted stock programs to clarify the timing of vesting for each type of award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also updated the Senior Executive Yearly Incentive Compensation Plan and the LTIP to conform the language between plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved a revised salary structure and an increase in the target percent of base salary for the cash portion of the LTIP for each Named Executive Officer based on the results of the Mercer market study conducted in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conclusion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation programs are designed and administered in a manner consistent with its conservative executive compensation philosophy and guiding principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The programs emphasize the retention of key executives and appropriate rewards for excellent results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee monitors these programs in recognition of the dynamic marketplace in which the Company competes for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will continue to emphasize pay-for-performance and equity-based incentive programs that compensate executives for results that are consistent with generating outstanding performance for its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys U.S. qualified noncontributory retirement plan has been in effect since 1947.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executive Officers participate in this plan on the same basis as other U.S. salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are eligible to become a member in the plan after completion of 12 months of employment with at least 1,000 hours of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan provides benefits based on years of service and salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are vested in their retirement benefits after five years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit for each year of service, up to a maximum of 35 years, is equal to one percent of the highest average salary plus 0.5 percent of highest average salary in excess of the Social-Security-covered compensation level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highest average salary is defined as the average of the highest 60 consecutive months of an employees cash compensation, which includes base salary and annual incentive cash compensation, but it excludes compensation under the LTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits are not subject to any deduction for Social Security or other offset amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits from the plan are paid as a monthly single-life annuity or, if married, actuarially-equivalent 50 percent, 75 percent or 100 percent joint and survivor annuity options are also available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Survivor benefits based on the 50 percent joint and survivor option will be paid to an eligible spouse if the employee is a vested member in the plan and dies before retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys unfunded U.S. Supplemental Retirement Plan (SRP) provides a retirement benefit to those affected by the maximum benefit limitations permitted for qualified plans by the Internal Revenue Code and to those deferring incentive compensation bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit is equal to the amount of normal pension benefit reduction resulting from the application of maximum benefit and salary limitations and the exclusion of deferred incentive compensation bonuses from the retirement plan benefit formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits from the plan are paid as a lifetime monthly annuity or a single lump-sum distribution at the executives election and the benefits will be paid at the later of: (1) termination of employment or (2) the date the participant attains age 55.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant dies before the supplemental benefit commencement date, the participants surviving spouse will be eligible to receive a survivor pension for the amount by which the total survivor pension benefit exceeds the surviving spouses retirement plan benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives terminated for cause, as defined in the Plan, forfeit all SRP benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Normal retirement age under both plans is 65, and participants may retire early between ages 55 and 65 if they have 15 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For retirement at ages 55 through 61 with 15 years of service, pension benefits are reduced four percent per year from age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 2: ADVISORY RESOLUTION TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION (SAY ON PAY)

sentences.text: In 2011, PACCAR stockholders voted to approve a three-year cycle review of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, PACCAR stockholders voted on an advisory basis to approve the compensation of the Named Executive Officers as required by section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act (15 U.S.C. 78n-1) (known as a say on pay vote).

sentences.text: Over 98% of the voted shares approved the compensation of the Named Executive Officers.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has delivered 78 consecutive years of net income, paid annual dividends every year since 1941 and delivered average annual total return to stockholders over the past 15 years of 14.7 percent versus 6.7 percent for the S&P 500.

sentences.text: The Companys executive compensation program provides excellent incentives for executives to deliver superior short- and long- term business performance and stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends an advisory vote to APPROVE the compensation of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) beginning on page 13 of this Proxy Statement describes in detail the Companys 2016 executive compensation program and the decisions made by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of the CD&A include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive-based pay (Pay for Performance) represents approximately 69 percent of the Named Executive Officers target total compensation, with approximately 47 percent related to long term incentives and 22 percent related to achievement of challenging annual performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executive Officers earn long-term equity awards in the form of restricted stock and stock options subject to multiple-year vesting requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes these awards ensure that a significant portion of the executives compensation reflects long-term growth in stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officer stock ownership guidelines align executives long-term goals with that of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer owns PACCAR stock greater than five times his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the Named Executive Officers has an employment agreement or severance arrangement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company RECOMMENDS stockholders APPROVE the following say on pay resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, THAT THE COMPENSATION PAID TO THE COMPANYS NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, AS DISCLOSED PURSUANT TO ITEM 402 OF REGULATION S-K INCLUDING THE COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS, COMPENSATION TABLES AND NARRATIVE DISCUSSION, IS HEREBY APPROVED.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote is an excellent method for stockholders to provide input on the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is not binding on the Company, the Board and Compensation Committee value the opinions expressed by stockholders and will consider the outcome of the vote when evaluating future executive compensation decisions.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TEM 3: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF THE SAY ON PAY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, PACCAR stockholders voted to approve a three-year cycle review of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, PACCAR Stockholders are again asked to vote on the timing of future advisory votes on compensation as required by section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act (15 U.S.C. 78n-1).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may choose among four options (you may vote for One Year, Two Years, Three Years or mark your proxy Abstain).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors RECOMMENDS A VOTE OF THREE YEARS because this frequency will provide our stockholders with sufficient time to evaluate the effectiveness of our compensation philosophy, objectives and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Essential components of the Companys Long Term Incentive Plan are measured over a three-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore it is appropriate for the advisory say on pay vote to occur over a similar timeframe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A three-year cycle will provide stockholders sufficient time to evaluate the effectiveness of the Companys short- and long- term compensation strategies and company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A three-year cycle allows the Board and the Compensation Committee to respond to stockholders suggestions and to implement modifications to its executive compensation policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote is an excellent method for stockholders to provide input on the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is not binding on the Company, the Board and Compensation Committee will review and consider the results of the vote in determining how often to conduct the stockholder vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE OF THREE YEARS ON ITEM 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 4: STOCKHOLDER PROPOSAL REGARDING SUPERMAJORITY VOTE PROVISIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4  Simple Majority Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, Shareholders request that our board take the steps necessary so that each voting requirement in our charter and bylaws that calls for a greater than simple majority vote be eliminated, and replaced by a requirement for a majority of the votes cast for and against applicable proposals, or a simple majority in compliance with applicable laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If necessary this means the closest standard to a majority of the votes cast for and against such proposals consistent with applicable laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners are willing to pay a premium for shares of companies that have excellent corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supermajority voting requirements have been found to be one of 6 entrenching mechanisms that are negatively related to company performance according to What Matters in Corporate Governance by Lucien Bebchuk, Alma Cohen and Allen Ferrell of the Harvard Law Schoo Supermajority requirements are used to block initiatives supported by most shareowners but opposed by a status quo management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal topic won from 74% to 88% support at Weyerhaeuser, Alcoa, Waste Management, Goldman Sachs, FirstEnergy, McGraw-Hill and Macys.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponents of these proposals included Ray T. Chevedden and William Steiner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently a 1%-minority can frustrate the will of our 66%-shareholder majority.
