sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OPPOSES THE PROPOSED RESOLUTION TO REPEAL THE SUPERMAJORITY VOTING PROVISIONS AND UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE AGAINST ITEM 4 FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCAR is committed to corporate governance policies and practices that enhance stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Its conservative policies ensure that the Company is governed in accordance with the highest standards of integrity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and in the best interest of its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration, the Board of Directors believes that the supermajority voting requirements are reasonable and appropriate for significant matters that affect the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys governance practices and strong financial performance have delivered outstanding long-term results to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is one of only 46 companies in the S&P 500 Index that has an S&P credit rating of A+ or better.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys governance structure positions the Company for profitable long-term growth, which benefits its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has delivered an average annual return to stockholders of 14.7 percent versus 6.7 percent for the S&P 500 percent return in the past 15 years ending December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supermajority voting requirements have been adopted by many leading companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many publicly traded S&P 500 companies have supermajority voting provisions including Eaton, United Technologies, Nike and many others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These companies recognize the benefits that result from this positive governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company stockholders have repeatedly rejected proposals to eliminate supermajority provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCAR stockholders approved the supermajority provisions in 1986 by a vote of 78 percent of the outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2008, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2016, Company stockholders rejected proposals to eliminate the supermajority provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the existing two-thirds voting requirement is reasonable and appropriate to maximize value for all stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCAR has an excellent record in stockholder returns, governance and responsiveness to stockholder concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponent provides no reason why PACCARs excellent long-term performance would be enhanced by eliminating its supermajority vote provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following points demonstrate the Companys commitment to sound corporate governance principles and long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders have shown strong support for the Companys directors in each of the past 20 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a strong program of environmental innovation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the leader in alternative fuel commercial vehicles with over 40 percent U.S. market share in natural gas vehicles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCAR achieved a score of A- from CDP (formerly the Carbon Disclosure Project), an internationally recognized organization which collects and analyzes data relating to greenhouse gas emissions and sustainability practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Certificate of Incorporation was amended in 2016 to allow for the annual election of all Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company regularly reviews its corporate governance and meets with many of its large investors each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCAR met with nearly 100 of its institutional investors in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors approved an amendment to the Companys Long Term Incentive Plan which added vesting schedules for stock options and restricted share awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys supermajority voting provisions ensure that a broad consensus of stockholders agree on significant corp changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Companys existing governance documents, a simple majority vote applies to many matters submitted for stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For significant corporate transactions, the Certificate of Incorporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides that stockholders of at least two-thirds of the outstanding voting stock must approve the recommended action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examples of these important corporate transactions include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: amendment of the Certificate of Incorporation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the sale, lease or exchange of all or substantially all of the Companys property and assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: removal of directors or the entire Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys merger or consolidation with another entity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: dissolution of the Company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approval of a stockholder action to replace, alter or repeal the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supermajority voting provisions protect PACCAR stockholders against the actions of short-term investors such as hedge funds or corporate activists.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys two-thirds supermajority vote provisions are designed to protect all PACCAR stockholders against coercive takeover tactics by requiring that a broad consensus of stockholders agree on significant corporate matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current voting provisions encourage persons or firms making unsolicited takeover bids to negotiate with the Board to ensure that the interests of all the Companys stockholders are considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the supermajority provisions allow the Board to consider alternative proposals that maximize the value of the Company for all stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supermajority voting provisions are in the best interest of PACCAR stockholders because they increase stability, improve long-term planning and represent a more comprehensive group of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the Company benefits from the existing supermajority vote requirement because it enhances corporate stability and enables the Board to pursue long-term corporate strategies for the benefit of all stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Major steps such as the sale, merger or dissolution of the Company should have the support of a supermajority of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE AGAINST ITEM 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 5: STOCKHOLDER PROPOSAL REGARDING PROXY ACCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Shareholders of PACCAR, Inc. (the Company) ask the board of directors (the Board) to take the steps necessary to adopt a proxy access bylaw.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such a bylaw shall require the Company to include in proxy materials prepared for a shareholder meeting at which directors are to be elected the name, Disclosure and Statement (as defined herein) of any person nominated for election to the board by a shareholder or group (the Nominator) that meets the criteria established below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall allow shareholders to vote on such nominee on the Companys proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shareholder-nominated candidates appearing in proxy materials shall not exceed the larger of two or one quarter of the directors then serving.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This bylaw, which shall supplement existing rights under Company bylaws, should provide that a Nominator must:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a) have beneficially owned 3% or more of the Companys outstanding common stock continuously for at least three years before submitting the nomination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: b) give the Company, within the time period identified in its bylaws, written notice of the information required by the bylaws and any Securities and Exchange Commission rules about
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the nominee, including consent to being named in the proxy materials and to serving as director if elected; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Nominator, including proof it owns the required shares (the Disclosure); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: c) certify that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) it will assume liability stemming from any legal or regulatory violation arising out of the Nominators communications with the Company shareholders, including the Disclosure and Statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) it will comply with all applicable laws and regulations if it uses soliciting material other than the Companys proxy materials; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) to the best of its knowledge, the required shares were acquired in the ordinary course of business and not to change or influence contr at the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominator may submit with the Disclosure a statement not exceeding 500 words in support of each nominee (the Statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board shall adopt procedures for promptly resolving disputes over whether notice of a nomination was timely, whether the Disclosure and Statement satisfy the bylaw and applicable federal regulations, and the priority to be given to multiple nominations exceeding the one-quarter limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUPPORTING STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe proxy access will make directors more accountable and enhance shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A 2014 study by the CFA Institute concluded that proxy access could raise overall US market capitalization by up to $140.3 billion if adopted market-wide, with little cost or disruption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (http://www.cfapubs.org/doi/pdf/10.2469/ccb.v2014.n9.1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposed terms are similar to those in vacated SEC Rule 14a-11 (https://www.sec.gov/rules/final/2010/33-9136.pdf).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC, following extensive analysis and input from market participants, determined that those terms struck the proper balance of providing shareholders with viable proxy access while containing appropriate safeguards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposed terms enjoy strong investor support and company acceptance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between January 2015 and October 2016, 95 similar shareholder proposals received majority votes and at least 270 companies of various sizes across industries enacted bylaws with similar terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge shareholders to vote FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS RESPONSE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OPPOSES THE PROPOSED RESOLUTION AND UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE AGAINST ITEM 5 FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal is similar to a proposal previously submitted by the same proponent at the Companys April 2016 Annual Meeting that was rejected by the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has carefully considered this stockholder proposal and recommends that stockholders vote against this proposal for the reasons set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCAR is committed to sound corporate governance policies and practices that enhance stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Its conservative policies ensure the Company is governed with the highest standards of integrity and in the best interest of its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Nominating and Governance Committee has an excellent process for recommending qualified director nominees, including candidates identified by an independent firm which assists in the review of director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considers nominees who are recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and stockholders approved an amendment to the Company Certificate of Incorporation which provides for the annual election of all directors, beginning with the class of directors elected at this 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual election of directors ensures that the full Board is accountable to stockholders for governance and financial performance on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the bylaws, directors are elected by a majority vote in uncontested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration, the Board of Directors believes that proxy access is not in the best interests of stockholders for the following reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access can significantly disrupt Company and Board operations and increase the Companys costs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access can be abused by special-interest groups who do not represent the long-term interests of stockholders and would use the proxy statement as a campaign tool;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access would undermine the role of the independent Nominating and Governance Committee in evaluating qualified Director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys existing corporate governance structure provides for meaningful and significant stockholder input in the director election and governance process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders can correspond directly with the Board and its individual Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders have the opportunity to solicit proxies for their own nominees for election of directors and present proposals for inclusion in the proxy and presentation at the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Implementation of the Proposal May Significantly Disrupt Company and Board Operations and Increase the Companys Co
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access may lead to an inexperienced, fragmented and unstable Board that is less efficient and less able to provide meaningful and effective oversight of the operations and long-term strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With proxy access, there is an increased likelihood that Director elections will be contested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contested elections can (1) divert the Board and management from their duties and responsibilities to the Company, (2) encourage a more short-term focus at the expense of long-term stockholder value, (3) reduce Board cohesiveness and (4) discourage highly qualified director candidates from serving because of the prospect of routinely standing for election in a contested situation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponents proxy access proposal could also increase the Companys costs by encouraging expensive and disruptive proxy contests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors Proposed by Special Interests Do Not Represent the Long-Term Interests of All Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access could inject special interest politics into the Boardroom by allowing an individual stockholder (or a minority group of stockholders) with narrowly tailored special interests or short-term goals to use the proxy to promote an agenda which favors the interests of the minority rather than the long-term interests of all of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, unlike the Board, stockholders who advance their nominees do not have a fiduciary duty to act in the best interests of the Company and protect fellow stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PACCARs Corporate Governance Structure is Best Suited to Evaluate Qualified Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Nominating and Governance Committee has a well-developed process for identifying, evaluating and recommending qualified Director nominees with a diverse and complementary blend of experiences, skills, gender and perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee retains an independent firm to assist in the identification of qualified director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prospective director nominees are recommended by the independent firm and candidates are reviewed thoroughly for suitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process is designed to identify and nominate for consideration those Director candidates who possess the training, experience and diverse background necessary to enhance the Companys business and adhere to the highest standards of corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee is in the best position to assess whether potential director nominees will contribute to an effective and well-rounded Board that operates openly and collaboratively and represents the interests of all stockholders, not just those with special interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access bypasses the rigorous screening of director candidates undertaken by the Nominating and Governance Committee and allows a proponent to place into nomination candidates who may lack the required mix of experience, skill and perspective needed to be an effective participant on the Companys Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
